measured_by: externalizing proportion (proportion of special circles for which a reminder was set)
justification: The paper defines “Externalizing proportion: the proportion of special circles for which the participant set an external reminder … This was measured by calculating the likelihood of dragging a target circle when it was not the next in the numerical sequence …”

measured_by: target accuracy (proportion of special circles correctly dragged to their target sides)
justification: Under “Key dependent measures” the authors state: “Target accuracy: the proportion of special circles correctly dragged to their target sides of matching colour, instead of to the bottom of the square.”
construct: Prospective-memory task performance / intention memory accuracy

justification: The methods section lists: “Metacognitive evaluation: a self-predictive measure with a range of 0% to 100% showing how confident participants thought they could accurately perform the task without external reminders.”

measured_by: difference between metacognitive judgement and objective unaided accuracy
justification: Results note that “The difference between these two measures indicated metacognitive bias, i.e., the extent of underconfidence.”
